Upgrade Requirements for This Release
 
Migration Guide > 

What's New in This Release

 
 
 

This topic lists the new features and bug fixes introduced in the 2015 release.

Beast

New features:

  • Support for baking Spherical Harmonics (SH) to texture with illumination pass.
  • Support for gathering a hemisphere around the normal while in world space.
  • Added these repeat modes: Wrap, Mirror, and Clamp for textures in legacy rendering.
  • Added automatic scaling of a number of render threads to eRnsT and Rendertool.
  • Added the alpha channel to camera renderings.

Improvements:

  • Reduced memory usage when reading parts of large frame buffers using the API.
  • Improved error handling and reporting.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed the issue of targets not baking when all UVs are outside the 0.1 range.
  • Fixed the issue of point cloud baking the illumination pass in the legacy render mode.
  • Fixed the issue of negative values in the variance sampler.
  • Fixed the issue of alpha channel readout in the API.
  • Fixed an issue in the job finished status when filter jobs fail.

Known Limitation

  • Beast does not detect more than 64 cores in a computer.

Distribeast 0.3.42.0

New features:

  • It is now possible to set a maximum CPU usage limit for tools. This feature requires Beast SDK 2014.0 or later. The jobs/maxTotalCpuPercentage setting is used for controlling the CPU usage. You can set jobs/maxTotalCpuPercentage from 1 to 100. If you start a tool on a node with jobs/maxTotalCpuPercentage set to a value other than 100, the job attempts to use an approximate number of threads corresponding to the set value. For example, if the setting is 13 on a 12-core system, it is rounded to use two threads. This means that about 17% CPU is used when threads are maxed out. This setting does not apply to tools that are started directly on a local machine (Beast real-time visualizer versus plain baking).
  • It is now possible to entirely avoid using performance counters by setting node/usePerformanceCounters to false.

Improvements:

  • Added a lock file to the session directory to prevent the directory from being deleted while the node is running.
  • The Dconfig utility now times out if commands are not completed on time.

Bug fixes:

  • Fixed the incorrect handling of corrupt performance counters.
  • Fixed the handling of file system errors when adding resources.
  • Fixed the issue of a node not sending a response for a StartTool request when a tool does not connect to the node in time. This issue used to block the rendertoolcontroller indefinitely.
  • Fixed an issue that caused nodes to deadlock when gathering logs on systems with two or less cores.
Please send us your comment about this page
